div1.p: Booth offers assistance to the Kissinger family.

div1.head: Letter from Carolyn H. Booth to Howard A. Kelly, July 17, 1907
div1.opener:
Dr Latimer.
Consider again
in the fall.
138 So Kenilworth Ave
Oak Park, Ill.
July 17-1907
Dear Dr. Kelly:-
div1.p:
A recent letter
from Mrs W. D. Morgan,
chairman of the Maryland
Branch of the “Shut-In” Society
brought to my attention
the case of Mr John R
Kissinger of South Bend
Ind- one of the states under
my care. I feel very
Ac
Ki
special interest in his
history, and this matter
of his pension interests
me deeply. My husband
and I are well acquainted
with ex-Senator Mason
who is again a candidate
from Ill. Is there any
thing do you suppose
that I could do to further
the interests of this pension
matter- I read about it
in an article from the
AC
Outlook sent me by Mrs Morgan.

I would be very grateful to
you for some little personal
word about Mr Kissinger to
whom I have written this
morning. I hope he will be-
come a member of our Society
--there will be no expense to him
that we may render some
service and cheer to him
if possible
div1.closer:
Very earnestly Carolyn H Booth
V.P. Shut-In Society
Ill. Ind. Mich. Wis. Minn. Mrs Harvey W Booth.
